snippet: When two top names in health care formed an alliance in Massachusetts, it did not turn out well for consumers.
abstract: Editorial asserts 1994 merger of Massachusetts General Hospital and Brigham and Women's Hospital into Partners Health Care system offers cautionary tale about risks of big hospital mergers; holds merger has given Partners enormous leverage to drive up prices and inhibit competition; says deal state's Atty Gen Martha Coakley struck with Partners only helps consumers temporarily; warns other states to proceed with caution, as mergers and their effects are hard to undo.
lead_paragraph: When two top names in health care formed an alliance in Massachusetts, it did not turn out well for consumers.
